page.title: 07Church
page.content: St. Mary's Church,Salehurst This is a large 13th century building made of Hastings sandstone,noted for its tall western tower,The present vicar is Rev. John Lambourne. {Local History}The present church is built on the site of a simple Saxon building and the earliest parts are believed to be dated between 1220 and 1250.The monks from the Abbey took charge and added to the building up to 1350.Little change was made until a major restoration took place in 1861 when the interior was completely altered. A Tithe Map may be seen in the church which shows the size of every field and its owner and rent.Some family names are still known in the Parish.
